Prepare for a meaningful career in public health with our CEPH-accredited in-person Master of Public Health (MPH) program. Designed to equip students with practical skills and real-world experience, the MPH program prepares future professionals to lead in healthcare, conduct impactful research, and advocate for healthier communities. Graduates are empowered to understand and improve population health, influence policy, and make lasting contributions to public service and community well-being.
Core Courses
Concentration Courses
Coursework in the data science concentration includes biostatistics, machine learning, and computer programming to answer public health questions and visualize and summarize results.
Our in-person MPH program can be undertaken on a full-time or part-time basis. The full-time MPH is a 15-month program that begins in a Fall Quarter, usually starting at the end of September, and concludes at the end of the following Fall Quarter, in December. The summer quarter is included in the program. Courses may also be taken on a flexible part-time schedule. For highly motivated students willing to take an extra course each quarter, the program can be completed in 12 months.
2023 MPH Graduate, Data Science Concentration
Email the Admissions Office at bsd-masters@uchicago.edu with any questions.

• Chicago Advantage: Engage with the city’s diverse neighborhoods and experience the opportunities and complexities of working in a great city.

SOPHAS is the centralized application service for public health programs. It simplifies the application process by allowing you to apply to multiple institutions using a single application.
The 2024-2025 SOPHAS application cycle is closed. The 2025-2026 application cycle will open August 13, 2025. Please view the SOPHAS Applicant Help Center and the Quick Start Guide to prepare for when the application will open.
A degree in public health allows students to concentrate in a variety of different academic and professional areas. Where will you make your impact?
Scholarships are mostly tax-free financial awards given to students with the intention to pursue a specific area of study or research. They are usually awarded based on certain qualifying traits.
As education in public health continues to evolve well past the classroom and into professional experience, ASPPH has developed learning institutes to train future public health leaders and offers a series of continuing education programs.
